alert.note: Alert for Murray; Pontotoc (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 30 at 4:16PM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Johnston, southwestern Pontotoc and northeastern Murray Counties through 445 PM CDT... At 416 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Hickory, moving north at 5 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Sulphur, Hickory, and Scullin. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
